topics.body:
Speaking of Books and school.

Has anyone ever went to their school library and just looked at all the books they have there and just ask themselves "Where the hell did they even get these?".

Like the strangest selection of books EVERYWHERE.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545c49066368723a97540100#post_545c49066368723a97540100
From what I remember from my school days most of the books seemed to be from the 80s at the earliest.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545c4a0b63687266afef0100#post_545c4a0b63687266afef0100
When I still was going to school they had a huge verity of books.

down to THE ENTIRE BIG ASS BOOK of the Chronicles of Narnia. 

Like they even had the Kingdom Hearts Manga in there? (I didn't even know that was a thing)
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545c4a9f6368727754550200#post_545c4a9f6368727754550200

Most are donations, other libraries have scouts that search for specific books or ask for someone to search for them.

It's more common in public and college libraries
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545c4a9f6368727754550200#post_545c4a9f6368727754550200
My high school library had the first to volumes of X and the both volumes of Akira. Freaking AKIRA!
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body: They also had a few One Piece volumes. As it turns out the school librarian was a big One Piece fan.
